channel.title: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?
channel.description:
Well the title says it. I want to see what I can/can't do with a client-sided commands. Is it possible to take an input String from the client and it'd send the player to a new location?
Also, how would you send false packets to a server and get items and such using the client?

item.title: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

It’s connected to the stream/reading bits.

i do believe it is in fact, the position-update stream/method.

just see which values change via teleporting/try creating a false stream to the server (though i don’t believe the server reads any data pertaining to positioning of the entities; so just try calling upon the method at your own will.

Read full topic
item.source: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?

item.title: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So in Method117, under if(k == 3){
I added:
System.out.println("K3 - L2: “+ l2 +” K2: “+k2+” J1: "+j1);

This looks like it is some form of player positioning. It updates when you enter a new region (Kind of, only saw it update when I teleported away from current pos), and when you first log in.
I’ll keep looking at 117.

Read full topic
item.source: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?

item.title: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

ripped from a project insanity client i found on my laptop; only three occurrences for Entity.setPos(int,int,bool) appear. one for npc, and two for players.

npc being method46 (again, i believe this is for creating the npc entity object)
player being method91 and method117.

i do believe (possibly wrong) method91 is for creating the player entity object, and i believe method117 is for updating the player movement.

try doing some tests/debugs yourself and see what you can come up with.

Read full topic
item.source: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?

item.title: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So this client has (int i, int j, boolean flag) for setPos.
[Keep in mind I’m really new to clients]
What would I do, client wise to attempt to force change my position?
client.java (I’d assume) and then where would I place it, and what would the flag be?
Entity.setPos(X, Y, Flag);

Read full topic
item.source: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?

item.title: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

most servers fixed validation for item spawning/spoofing. the can however force the client to believe you have an item when you don’t (great for those pesky servers that handle click items to give items without actually checking whether you have the item or not)

you can use the click_object packet to trick the client to clicking on any given object (project insanity for instance, doesn’t check to see if the object exists at those given coordinates) and use such things as ladders/portals etc. to teleport amongst the game (great for teleporting during pking as most users “oh look, portal at home: dont need to check if user is in wild/combat/etc”)

you can also do this to the click_npc / click_item packet for any instance of teleporting

i do believe method46 can spawn an npc in the location (not sure about it. just going off memory - don’t have my client at hand)

you can attempt to change the position (haven’t tried it in this manner) using the Entity.setPos() method.

Read full topic
item.source: Client Hacking - Can you teleport using client sided commands?
